What do you define as self-defence? You endlessly claim that "guns are used to kill more than they're used in self-defence". 
 
 Does it not count as self-defence unless somebody gets shot? And finally, if the answer is "yes", well, then using your own logic against you, I could conclude that self-defence is not a valid reason for shooting someone... and most judges seem to agree.

post_info.post_title: Another question for the Brady Bunch

Same response as the last question...
 
 Straw man! Self-defence includes threatening behaviour - as you would have learnt if you had the patience to wait for my response rather than run to the 'new thread' button...

Same response as the last question...
 
 Straw man! Self-defence includes threatening behaviour - as you would have learnt if you had the patience to wait for my response rather than run to the 'new thread' button...

 
 So... you're saying that you'd rather have a law-abiding citizen victimized than a criminal threatened? emoticon_wow

Again with the response. Straw man! I don't even see how you got to this one...
 
 Oh, wait, I do. You've taken the best possible legal use of firearms (for self-defence, at least), compared it to one of the worst possible illegal uses of firearms, and assumed that because it supports you that this is how things work.
 
 Unfortunately, you still don't have any evidence that this is the case. Evidence, that is, that isn't already being discussed/countered in several different threads.
